channel.title: Ma upgrade
channel.description:
E6850 @ 3.0ghz 2gb ddr2 800mhz ballistix tracers 8800gt 512mb IP35 mobo
->
AMD Athlon X4 945 (AM3) 3.0ghz 4GB (2x2) G.Skill DDR3 1333mhz ATI radeon 4890 1gb Gigabyte MA790XT-UD4P
soon to get another 4890, after a PSU and an SSD. shits gonna be off the hook.

item.title: Ma upgrade
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Yes, ASRock sucks badly. Coming from someone who’s had to buy ASR crap for the past 4 years due to his budget.
Going to upgrade in half a year, using a portion of my inheritance money, and buy a good pc without budget hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Ma upgrade
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:11, topic:289780”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=383058.msg2877706#msg2877706 date=1248141314]

i was on the verge of spending a few extra bucks on the i7 processor, until i noticed the cheapest i7 motherboard was like 2-3* more than the one i brought.

I’ll overclock this CPU when i get a better cooler, this stock AMD fan screams like a bitch as it is.

asrock is releasing a really nice budget i7 mobo, i think like $160
[/quote]

Sadly, asrock makes budget hardware, because it’s crap hardware. imo.[/quote]i second that. When my gf brought a socket 775 asrock mobo with SLI, and a bunch of other cool features, for 100$ AUD, i knew something was dodgey about it. a month later had to go shopping for a new one :\

Read full topic

i was on the verge of spending a few extra bucks on the i7 processor, until i noticed the cheapest i7 motherboard was like 2-3* more than the one i brought.

I’ll overclock this CPU when i get a better cooler, this stock AMD fan screams like a bitch as it is.
[/quote]
asrock is releasing a really nice budget i7 mobo, i think like $160[/quote]

Sadly, asrock makes budget hardware, because it’s crap hardware. imo.
